blocks.name: iota0def
blocks.content: Example for a defined iota being the empty set, i.e., ` A. y x C_ y ` is a wff satisfied by a unique value ` x ` , namely ` x = (/) ` (the empty set is the one and only set which is a subset of every set). (Contributed by AV, 24-Aug-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm iota0def(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wceq(cio(s0, wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), emptycls)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  mp2an(wceq(cio(s0, wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), emptycls), wcel(emptycls, universe), wcel(emptycls, universe))
  0ex()
  iota5(s0, emptycls, universe, wcel(emptycls, universe), wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  a1i(wa(wcel(emptycls, universe), wcel(emptycls, universe)), wb(wal(s1, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls)))
  al0ssb(s1, cv(s0))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, emptycls, universe)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: iota0ndef
blocks.content: Example for an undefined iota being the empty set, i.e., ` A. y y e. x ` is a wff not satisfied by a (unique) value ` x ` (there is no set, and therefore certainly no unique set, which contains every set). (Contributed by AV, 24-Aug-2022.)
